snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Tuesday's selection includes an app that estimates how much money Google and Facebook make from you each year and a report that iPhone users in...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Tuesday's selection includes an app that estimates how much money Google and Facebook make from you each year and a report that iPhone users in Finland are sending fewer text messages.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Privacy's Price Tag, and Pandora Money
